intro: Colubrina venezuelensis, commonly known as the Venezuelan colubrina, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Venezuela and neighboring regions. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many economically important plants. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a glossy surface. The flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and usually have five petals, with colors ranging from white to pink.
